column4: A law that protects creators’ work by giving them legal rights over how their work is used and distributed.

definition: A law that allows authorities to monitor electronic communications and require access to encrypted data under certain conditions.
Moral concerns about what is right or wrong in the use of computer technology.
The effects of digital technology on society and how people live and interact.
The use of computers and automation in jobs
column4: which can increase efficiency but also lead to job losses and retraining needs.

definition: The use of algorithms to make decisions without human involvement
column4: which can be fast but may be biased or unfair.

definition: Computer systems designed to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence
column4: such as learning or decision making.

definition: When AI systems produce unfair outcomes due to biased data or programmer assumptions.
The effect of computing on the environment
The gap between people who have access to digital technology and those who do not.
The blocking or restricting of access to online content by governments or organisations.
Tracking user activity such as browsing history
Collecting and processing personal data to identify patterns or make predictions about individuals.
The right of individuals to control how their personal information is collected and used.
The illegal copying or distribution of software

column5: or harmful messages using digital technologies.

definition: Designing systems so they can be used by people with disabilities or different needs.
The way content is arranged on a screen to improve usability and readability.

column4: taking into account cultural meanings and accessibility.

definition: Collections of characters used to represent text
A universal character encoding standard that supports text from many languages and cultures.
A linear development model where each stage is completed in order before moving to the next.
An iterative development approach that focuses on flexibility
An agile method that emphasises constant user involvement
